Description: Body sherd of Chian Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; traces of two bands in added white; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of shield with rosette as device and the points of two spears.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.504. Lemos does not describe this sherd but does discuss the sherd belonging to the same vase which she ascribes to the Grey-Slip Group. The sherds in this group characteristically have a grey coloured slip.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0805) (phase 2)
